summary:
## The Wars of the Roses: A Simplified Summary

The Wars of the Roses (1455-1487) were fights between the Lancasters and Yorks, two branches of the same royal family, over who should rule England. The wars started because of economic problems and arguments over who had the best claim to the throne. After lots of battles and changes, the Yorks won, but their king, Richard III, was defeated by Henry Tudor in 1485.

Henry Tudor became King Henry VII and married Elizabeth of York, uniting the two families and starting the Tudor dynasty which ruled England for a long time.
title: Wars of the Roses
